intro: Juncus tenageia subsp. tenageia, commonly known as the slender rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils along streams, ponds, and wetlands. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of greenish-white flowers. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water. Its botanical structure is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
